description: Change of use from single dwellinghouse (C3 Use Class) into a small  House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) (C4 Use Class) to contain 5 bedrooms for a maximum of 5 persons, alteration of rear windows at first floor, associated cycle parking and refuse storage, and retention of ancillary outbuilding.
decision_conditions: The modifications shown on the approved plans, shall be completed within six (6) months of the date of this permission, failing which this permission will lapse and be on no force and effect.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Sheet 5 of 5 (Block plan); Proposed floor plans (unnumbered); Proposed outbuilding elevations (unnumbered); Proposed outbuilding plan (unnumbered);Proposed elevations (unnumbered).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than five (5) occupants within five (5) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.

| The  rear outbuilding, as approved, shall only be used for purposes ancillary to the small house of mulitple occupation hereby approved, and shall not be used or adapted for habitable accommodation as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), the Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish policies D1 and D4; and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Certification shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the party wall between 36 Brassie Avenue and 32 Brassie Avenue is designed and constructed meeting the requirements for airborne sound insulation in accordance with Approved Document E [Resistance to the passage of sound].

Reason:  In the interests of amenity for the neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D13 of the Draft New London Plan 2019, policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.
Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); policies D1 and D4 of the Draft New London Plan(2019), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The existing side garden space with planting and boundary hedge as shown on the approved block plan shall be retained as amenity space for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To maintain the visual amenity of th eproperty and the area's prevailing character and setting for corner gardens as whole plots for the benefit and enjoyment of all occupants of the property in accordance with policies 7.4 of the London Plan(2016); policy G5 of the Draft New London Plan(2019); Ealing's Development Management DPD policy 5.10 and 7.4; and the NPPF(2019).

| The forecourt planting, rear garden planting and sedum roof to the outbuilding as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the develoment, as approved, and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development.  Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 7.4 and 7.5 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policy G5; The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | At least five (5) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site prior to occupation of the development and retained thereafter
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3 and Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish policy T5 and table 10.2

| Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on drawing reference SHEET 5 of 5 Block Plan, shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Plan DPD, 2013; Policy 1.1 (e) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, and Policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
